spatial_accuracy.notes: Major layout disagreement between plan and render. The right-side stair zone shown in the 2D plan is not represented in the 3D model (space is instead treated as regular room façade with windows) (E1/E2). Bedroom position appears shifted to the left/front in the 3D (bed placed along the main windowed façade), while the plan locates the bedroom at the top-right (E2). Central core (bath/closet/hall) geometry and wall alignment do not match the plan’s clean rectangular partitions (E2). Exterior entry locations from the plan (left-side door and bottom-right door) are not clearly present/placed correctly in the 3D (E1/E2). Window counts and positions do not correspond to the plan (E2/E4). Room proportions are distorted: the main living zone and bedroom proportions relative to the core differ noticeably (E4).

structural_fidelity.notes: Wall thicknesses appear more uniform than the plan’s heavy exterior vs lighter interior convention, but multiple partitions do not follow the plan’s adjacency logic (E2). The stairwell/vertical circulation element on the right edge of the plan is missing entirely (E1), breaking key adjacency relationships (hall↔stairs, stairs↔entry) (E2). Door embedding/orientation is inconsistent: several planned swing doors (bedroom/bath/hall) are not clearly modeled or are relocated (E1/E2/E3). The 3D introduces an over-complicated central cluster of small volumes compared to the plan, suggestive of extra/altered rooms or closets (E5).

furniture_mapping.notes: Furniture does not reliably map to the plan: the bed appears in a zone that reads as the main façade/living side rather than the plan’s top-right bedroom (E2). Kitchen island/counter arrangement is only loosely similar and appears shifted relative to the plan’s kitchen location (E2). Furniture scale is generally plausible, but placement-to-room association is frequently incorrect (E2).

aesthetic_quality.notes: Isometric camera is coherent and readable (minor perspective/orthographic mismatch typical of isometric renders). Lighting is soft and clean; geometry is mostly crisp. However, openings/windows look generic and repetitive, reducing fidelity/clarity to the source plan. No major rendering artifacts, but some wall/void transitions appear simplified compared to architectural detailing.

detected_errors.description: Missing stairwell/steps along the right side that are clearly shown in the 2D plan.
Planned exterior entry doors (left-side door and bottom-right door) are not clearly present or are not placed as in the plan.
Bedroom is misplaced: 3D bed/bedroom zone appears on the main façade/left side rather than the plan’s top-right bedroom.
Central core partitions (bath/closet/hall) do not align with the plan’s wall layout and room boundaries.
Window placement and counts do not match: the 3D shows large repetitive façade windows where the plan shows fewer, differently positioned openings (including the stair-side window pattern).
Room proportions are distorted relative to the plan, especially the relationship between living/kitchen area, bedroom, and the central core.
Hallucinated/extra interior volumes: the 3D central cluster suggests additional/altered small rooms/closets not evidenced by the 2D plan.
Door orientation/embedding is inconsistent with the plan’s swing-door locations between hall/bedroom/bath; several appear missing or relocated.
